Machine Learning

1. Supervised learning

1.1 Linear Regression Model(线性回归)

(1) The model function

fw,b(x(i))=wx(i)+b

 

  • 主要是通过数据确定w和b,然后 输入一个值 预测 其对应的值.

  • 预测函数代码实现：

1
def predict(x,w,b):
2
    y = x*w + b
3
    return y

(2) Cost Function

Squared error cost:

J(w,b)=12m∑i=0m−1(fw,b(x(i))−y(i))2

where fw,b(x(i))=wx(i)+b

  • w,b是我们训练的参数，12m里面的2是为了求偏导时,使后面的式子更简洁.

  • (fw,b(x(i))−y(i))2 是目标值与预测值的平均方差,我们自己训练出的w,b来计算y,与实际y值相减.

  • 计算Cost Function的代码如下：

    ​x
    1
    def cost_function(x,y,w,b):
    2
        m = x.shape[0]
    3
    

    4
        cost_sum = 0 
    5
        for i in range(m): 
    6
            f_wb = w * x[i] + b   
    7
            cost = (f_wb - y[i]) ** 2  
    8
            cost_sum = cost_sum + cost
    9
            
    10
        total_cost = (1 / (2 * m)) * cost_sum  
    11
    

    12
        return total_cost

     

(3) Gradient Descent

w=w−α∂J(w,b)∂w
b=b−α∂J(w,b)∂b

α是学习率

J(w,b)是一个如下图：

都可导，可通过梯度算法更新参数w,b,得到最小的J,从而得到最合理的w,b

(3.1) Batch Gradient Descent （批量梯度下降）

∂J(w,b)∂w=1m∑i=0m−1(fw,b(x(i))−y(i))x(i)
∂J(w,b)∂b=1m∑i=0m−1(fw,b(x(i))−y(i))

代码实现方法：

  • 通过Cost function对参数求偏导

  • 在大量数据中，每次梯度下降都要对所有样本计算，计算量大

(3.2) Stochastic Gradient Descent (随机梯度下降)

∂J(w,b)∂b=(fw,b(x(i)−y(i))
∂J(w,b)∂b=(fw,b(x(i)−y(i))

 

随机抽取某个数据来当做下降梯度，降低复杂度，但有较大的振荡.

(3.3) Small Batch Gradient Descent

结合上述两个方法，随机抽取样本中一部分数据，公式为：

∂J(w,b)∂w=1k∑ii+k(fw,b(x(i))−y(i))x(i)
∂J(w,b)∂b=1k∑ii+k(fw,b(x(i))−y(i))

通常最常用的也是小批量梯度下降算法，计算速度快，收敛稳定。

1.2 Multiple Variable Linear Regression (多元线性回归)

(1) Model function

fw,b=w0x0+w1x1+...+wn−1xn−1+b

在此模型中,有多个x值对最终结果y值有影响。

用向量表示为：

fw,b(x→)=w→⋅x→+b

  • 其中 w→=[w1w2...wn−1] x→=(x0(0)x1(0)...xn−1(0)x0(1)x1(1)...xn−1(1)...x0(m−1)x1(m−1)...xn−1(m−1))

 

  • 预测函数代码实现：

  • xxxxxxxxxx
    3
    1
    def predict(x,w,b):
    2
        y = np.dot(x,w)+b
    3
        return y

(2) Cost function

J(w→,b)=12m∑i=0m−1(fw→,b(X(i)−y(i)))2

where

fw→,b(X(i))=w→⋅x→(i)+b

  • i代表样本, 实际中是第几行

  • 计算Cost function的代码如下：

    xxxxxxxxxx
    8
    1
    def cost_function(X, y, w, b): 
    2
        m = X.shape[0] #0表示行
    3
        cost = 0.0
    4
        for i in range(m):                                
    5
            f_wb_i = np.dot(X[i], w) + b           #(n,)(n,) = scalar (see np.dot)
    6
            cost = cost + (f_wb_i - y[i])**2       #scalar
    7
        cost = cost / (2 * m)                      #scalar    
    8
        return cost

(3) Gradient Descent

repeat until convergence:{wj=wj−α∂J(w,b)∂wj  for j=0,...n−1b=b−α∂J(w,b)∂b}

where n是特征的数量，wj,b是更新的参数,其中：

∂J(w,b)∂wj=1m∑i=0m−1(fw,b(X(i))−y(i))xj(i)∂J(w,b)∂b=1m∑i=0m−1(fw,b(X(i))−y(i))

  • m是训练样本个数

  • fw,b(X(i))是自己训练出的预测值，y(i)是实际目标值

  • 实现代码如下：

    xxxxxxxxxx
    37
    1
    def gradient_function(X, y, w, b):
    2
        m,n = X.shape           #(number of examples, number of features)
    3
        dj_dw = np.zeros((n,))
    4
        dj_db = 0.
    5
    

    6
        for i in range(m):                             
    7
            err = (np.dot(X[i], w) + b) - y[i]   
    8
            for j in range(n):                         
    9
                dj_dw[j] = dj_dw[j] + err * X[i, j]    
    10
            dj_db = dj_db + err                        
    11
        dj_dw = dj_dw / m                                
    12
        dj_db = dj_db / m                                
    13
            
    14
        return dj_db, dj_dw
    15
    def gradient_descent(X, y, w_in, b_in, cost_function, gradient_function, alpha, num_iters): 
    16
        J_history = []
    17
        w = copy.deepcopy(w_in)  #avoid modifying global w within function
    18
        b = b_in
    19
        
    20
        for i in range(num_iters):
    21
    

    22
            # Calculate the gradient and update the parameters
    23
            dj_db,dj_dw = gradient_function(X, y, w, b)   ##None
    24
    

    25
            # Update Parameters using w, b, alpha and gradient
    26
            w = w - alpha * dj_dw               ##None
    27
            b = b - alpha * dj_db               ##None
    28
          
    29
            # Save cost J at each iteration
    30
            if i<100000:      # prevent resource exhaustion 
    31
                J_history.append( cost_function(X, y, w, b))
    32
    

    33
            # Print cost every at intervals 10 times or as many iterations if < 10
    34
            if i% math.ceil(num_iters / 10) == 0:
    35
                print(f"Iteration {i:4d}: Cost {J_history[-1]:8.2f}   ")
    36
            
    37
        return w, b, J_history #return final w,b and J history for graphing

(4)Feature Scaling

  • 由于每个指标的值都不一样,有些值可能相差很大,导致在迭代计算参数w→,b时，可能会出现不收敛的情况，需采用特征缩放(Feature Scaling)

  • 线性回归问题中常采用的是 z-score normalization,其公式为：

    xj(i)=xj(i)−μjσj

    其中j是 特征即列，uj是样本中该特征的均值，σj是样本中该特征的标准差（用样本均值和标准差代替该问题的均值和方差）,具体公式如下：

    uj=1m∑i=0m−1xj(i)σj2=1m∑i=0m−1(xj(i)−μj)2

  • 实现代码如下：

    xxxxxxxxxx
    9
    1
    def zscore_normalize_features(X):
    2
        # find the mean of each column/feature
    3
        mu     = np.mean(X, axis=0)                 # mu will have shape (n,)
    4
        # find the standard deviation of each column/feature
    5
        sigma  = np.std(X, axis=0)                  # sigma will have shape (n,)
    6
        # element-wise, subtract mu for that column from each example, divide by std for that column
    7
        X_norm = (X - mu) / sigma      
    8
    

    9
        return (X_norm, mu, sigma)

(5) Polynomial Regression

  • 采用多项式拟合数据，如：y=1+x2

  • 采用目标函数：y=w0x02+b,输入数据时我们直接将X2,这一步称为Feature Engineering示范代码如下：

    xxxxxxxxxx
    8
    1
    x = np.arange(0, 20, 1)
    2
    y = 1 + x**2
    3
    

    4
    # Engineer features 
    5
    X = x**2      #<-- added engineered feature
    6
    

    7
    X = X.reshape(-1, 1)  #X should be a 2-D Matrix
    8
    model_w,model_b = run_gradient_descent_feng(X, y, iterations=10000, alpha = 1e-5)

  • 如果我们采用模型（目标）函数为：y=w0x0+w1x12+w2x23+b，Feature Engineering代码如下：

    xxxxxxxxxx
    6
    1
    x = np.arange(0, 20, 1)
    2
    y = x**2
    3
    

    4
    # engineer features .
    5
    X = np.c_[x, x**2, x**3]   #<-- added engineered feature
    6
    model_w,model_b = run_gradient_descent_feng(X, y, iterations=10000, alpha=1e-7)

从该模型我们得出w→=[0.08 0.54 0.03],x2项的系数明显远大于其余项的系数

Gradient descent is picking the 'correct' features for us by emphasizing its associated parameter

  • Intially, the features were re-scaled so they are comparable to each other

  • less weight value implies less important/correct feature, and in extreme, when the weight becomes zero or very close to zero, the associated feature useful in fitting the model to the data.

  • above, after fitting, the weight associated with the x2 feature is much larger than the weights for x or x3 as it is the most useful in fitting the data.

    fw→,b=g(w→⋅x→(i)+b)

    where

    z=w→⋅x→(i)+bg(z)=11+e−z

  • Eventually,our Function is：

    fw→,b=11+e−(w→⋅x→ + b)

(2) Decision Boundaries

  • As using sigmoid function,we can easily see,g(z)>=0.5,for z>=0

  • In linear regression,z=w→⋅x→+b,So that:

    If w→⋅x→+b>=0,the model predicts y=1

    Ifw→⋅x→+b<0,the model predicts y=0

  • So we Let w→⋅x→+b=0,we can get the Decison Boundaries.

A simple :

  • Our Logistic regression model has the form

    f(x)=g(−3+x0+x1)

  • we make −3+x0+x1=0,our boundaries is x0+x1=3,as folliowing figures:

(3) Cost Function

  • If we still use Squared error for Lgistic Regression:

J(w,b)=12m∑i=0m−1(fw,b(x(i))−y(i))2

We Just have many Local minimum,Such as:

 

  • So,we use a better function for Logistic Regression:

    loss(fw→,b(X(i),y(i)))={−log⁡(fw→,b(x→(i)))if y(i)=1log⁡(1−fw→,b(x→(i)))if y(i)=0we simpplify this equation causing y only can get 1 or 0:loss(fw→,b(X(i),y(i)))=−(y(i)log⁡fw→,b(X(i)))−(1−y(i))log⁡(1−fw→,b(X(i)))

 

  • where fw→,b(x(i))=g(w→⋅x→(i)+b)=11+e−(w→⋅x→+b)

  • Its figures of cost function:

  • Its figure about w→,b,as follwing:

  • It avoids local minnimum,when we use Gradient Descent,we can get good result.

  • Thing about why using this function for myself ! (Tips:about maximum likelihood estimation(最大似然估计))

  • Eventually,Cost Function is:

    J(w,b)=1m∑i=0m−1[loss(fw→,b(x(i)),y(i))]=−1m∑i=0m−1(y(i)log⁡fw→,b(X(i)))+(1−y(i))log⁡(1−fw→,b(X(i)))

    where loss(fw→,b(X(i),y(i)))=−(y(i)log⁡fw→,b(X(i)))−(1−y(i))log⁡(1−fw→,b(X(i))),m is number of training examples.

  • Code:

    def compute_cost_logistic(X, y, w, b):
    11
        m = X.shape[0]
    12
        cost = 0.0
    13
        for i in range(m):
    14
            z_i = np.dot(X[i],w) + b
    15
            f_wb_i = sigmoid(z_i)
    16
            cost +=  -y[i]*np.log(f_wb_i) - (1-y[i])*np.log(1-f_wb_i)
    17
                 
    18
        cost = cost / m
    19
        return cost

(4)Gradient Descent

Recall the gradient descent in the Linear Regression:

repeat until convergence:{wj=wj−α∂J(w,b)∂wjfor j=0..n−1b=b−α∂J(w,b)∂b}

where each iteration updates wj,b for all j,where

∂J(w,b)∂w=1m∑i=0m−1(fw,b(x(i))−y(i))x(i)
∂J(w,b)∂b=1m∑i=0m−1(fw,b(x(i))−y(i))

Notice that:

  • it's similar to Linear Regression's gradient function,we can verify it by myself.

  • Some differentiation:

  • fw,b(x(i))=g(z)=11+e−z(z=w⋅x+b)

  • Code:

    def sigmoid(z):
    2
        z = np.clip( z, -500, 500 )           # protect against overflow
    3
        """
    4
        np.clip: 将z的值限定在最大、最小值中
    5
        """
    6
        g = 1.0/(1.0+np.exp(-z))
    7
        
    8
        return g
    9
    

    10
    def compute_gradient_logistic(X, y, w, b): 
    11
        m,n = X.shape
    12
        dj_dw = np.zeros((n,))                           #(n,)
    13
        dj_db = 0.
    14
    

    15
        for i in range(m):
    16
            f_wb_i = sigmoid(np.dot(X[i],w) + b)          #(n,)(n,)=scalar  
    17
            #计算 f,自己模型预测值
    18
            err_i  = f_wb_i  - y[i]                       #scalar
    19
            for j in range(n):
    20
                dj_dw[j] = dj_dw[j] + err_i * X[i,j]      #scalar
    21
            dj_db = dj_db + err_i
    22
        dj_dw = dj_dw/m                                   #(n,)
    23
        dj_db = dj_db/m                                   #scalar
    24
            
    25
        return dj_db, dj_dw  
    26
    

    27
    def gradient_descent(X, y, w_in, b_in, alpha, num_iters): 
    28
        J_history = []
    29
        w = copy.deepcopy(w_in)  #avoid modifying global w within function
    30
        b = b_in
    31
        
    32
        for i in range(num_iters):
    33
            # Calculate the gradient and update the parameters
    34
            dj_db, dj_dw = compute_gradient_logistic(X, y, w, b)   
    35
    

    36
            # Update Parameters using w, b, alpha and gradient
    37
            w = w - alpha * dj_dw               
    38
            b = b - alpha * dj_db               
    39
          
    40
            # Save cost J at each iteration
    41
            if i<100000:      # prevent resource exhaustion 
    42
                J_history.append( compute_cost_logistic(X, y, w, b) )
    43
    

    44
            # Print cost every at intervals 10 times or as many iterations if < 10
    45
            if i% math.ceil(num_iters / 10) == 0:
    46
                print(f"Iteration {i:4d}: Cost {J_history[-1]}   ")
    47
            
    48
        return w, b, J_history         #return final w,b and J history for graphing

Regularzation to deal with problem of our model that overfiting

When our model is too much complex,we can see the scense called overfiting,such as:

  • Visably,it may be good for data,but not fit to actual use.Three methood is introduced:

    • 1, Add more data

    • 2, Find more important features

      -Feature selection

    • 3, Reduce size of paramaters

      -"Regularization"

1. Linear Regression introducing Regularzation

we want some less important features to closely vanish,so we just want our wj to be more smaller.

We add a formula in our original cost function:

λ2m∑j=0n−1wj2

where λ is similar to α ,is regularzation parameter.

Noting:

  • we want λ big but not too big,generally we make it be 1.

  • The coefficient 2 is to make more smooth to be used in gradient descent

  • squared w is to applied in Gradient Descent,when we use Gradient Descent,we make our w to be more smaller.

(1) Cost Function

Eventually,Our cost function is:

J(w,b)=12m∑i=0m−1(fw,b(x(i))−y(i))2+λ2m∑j=0n−1wj2

  • Code:

    xxxxxxxxxx
    16
    1
    def compute_cost_linear_reg(X, y, w, b, lambda_ = 1):
    2
        m  = X.shape[0]
    3
        n  = len(w)
    4
        cost = 0.
    5
        for i in range(m):
    6
            f_wb_i = np.dot(X[i], w) + b             #(n,)(n,)=scalar, see np.dot
    7
            cost = cost + (f_wb_i - y[i])**2                               #scalar             
    8
        cost = cost / (2 * m)                                              #scalar  
    9
     
    10
        reg_cost = 0
    11
        for j in range(n):
    12
            reg_cost += (w[j]**2)                                          #scalar
    13
        reg_cost = (lambda_/(2*m)) * reg_cost                              #scalar
    14
        
    15
        total_cost = cost + reg_cost                                       #scalar
    16
        return total_cost                                                  #scalar

(2) Gradient Descent

  • we Just use original methood:

repeat until convergence:{wj=wj−α∂J(w,b)∂wjfor j=0..n−1b=b−α∂J(w,b)∂b}

now the ∂J(w,b)∂wj and \frac{\partial J(w,b)}{\part b} is identically different:

∂J(w,b)∂w=1m∑i=0m−1(fw,b(x(i))−y(i))x(i)+λmwj∂J(w,b)∂b=1m∑i=0m−1(fw,b(x(i))−y(i))

  • Code:

    1
    def compute_gradient_linear_reg(X, y, w, b, lambda_): 
    2
        m,n = X.shape           #(number of examples, number of features)
    3
        dj_dw = np.zeros((n,))
    4
        dj_db = 0.
    5
    

    6
        for i in range(m):                             
    7
            err = (np.dot(X[i], w) + b) - y[i]                 
    8
            for j in range(n):                         
    9
                dj_dw[j] = dj_dw[j] + err * X[i, j]               
    10
            dj_db = dj_db + err                        
    11
        dj_dw = dj_dw / m                                
    12
        dj_db = dj_db / m   
    13
        
    14
        # regularzatiton
    15
        for j in range(n):
    16
            dj_dw[j] = dj_dw[j] + (lambda_/m) * w[j]
    17
    

    18
        return dj_db, dj_dw

     

2. Logistic Regression introducing Regularzation

(1) Cost function

It is similar to above:

J(w→,b)=−(y(i)log⁡fw→,b(X(i)))−(1−y(i))log⁡(1−fw→,b(X(i)))+λ2m∑j=0n−1wj2

where

fw→,b(x→)=sigmoid(w→⋅x→(i)+b)=11+e−(w→⋅x→(i)+b)

Just introducing λ2m∑j=0n−1wj2 in original function.

(2) Gradient Descent

repeat until convergence:{wj=wj−α∂J(w,b)∂wjfor j=0..n−1b=b−α∂J(w,b)∂b}

where

∂J(w,b)∂w=1m∑i=0m−1(fw,b(x(i))−y(i))x(i)+λmwj∂J(w,b)∂b=1m∑i=0m−1(fw,b(x(i))−y(i))

  • Difference:

    • fw→,b(x(i))=w→⋅x→+b

    • z=w→⋅x→+b

    • g(z)=11+e−z

  • m is the number of training examples in the data set,fw→,b(x(i))=w→⋅x→+b is the model's prediction, while y(i)is the target.

  • code:

Model Evaluation

(1) Set

  • we need "Training" and "Test" set

    • if we don't have more Test set, we can spilt the original Training set to evaluate the model

  • we just have a error function to evaluate our model and improve our model

    • so we split original set to three set: Training, Cross-validation(to improve model), Test(evaluate model)

  • Somtimes,we just use some rate to do above:

  • we just have three cost function to evaluate our model:

    JtrainJteestJcv

  • Its equation accordingly project to each model you choose.

(2) Model selecion

In reality,we can not choose right model for actual problem at once.

It we want to automatically choose a model,we can use above cost funcion.

  • we can train many models and simultaneously compute Jcv that cross-validation cost.

  • we choose the minimum of Jcv to be our model and then cmpute Jtest.

  • training and cross-validation set help our to choose model, test set(Jtest) help our model to have a good generaliztion.

(3) Bais and Variance

    1. High bias (underfit):

Jtrainis highJcvis highJtrain≈Jcv

    1. High variance (overfit):

    Jtrainis  lowJcvis highJtrain>>Jcv

    1. "Right":

    Jtrainis lowJcvis low

    1. High bias and high variance:

    Jtrainis highJcvis highJcv>>Jtrain

  •  

(4) Learning curve

  • If our model is "High bias":

    • Adding more data can not minimize error

    • Maybe we should change our model or other methood

    • Try getting additional features

    • Try adding polynomial features

    • Try decreasing λ

  • If our model is "High variance":

    • Aading more data is indeed likely to help

    • Try smaller sets of teatures (similar to Regluarzation)

    • Try increasing λ

 

 

 

 

2. Unsuperised learning

2.1 K_means

聚类算法追求“簇内差异小，簇外差异大”。而这个“差异“由我们自己衡量，一般有如下标准：

欧氏距离：d(x,u)=∑i=11(xi−μi)2曼哈顿距离：d(x,u)=∑i=1n(|xi−μi|)余弦距离：cosθ=∑in(xi∗μ)∑1n(xi)2∗∑1n(μ)2

(1) 流程

我们用欧式距离来演示K_means算法, 具体流程如下：

  1. 选择K个随机点作为聚类中心 (cluster centroids)

  2. 遍历数据集中的每个数据，算出每个数据到K个点的距离，将该点和距离最近的聚类中心聚成一类

  3. 计算出K个类别，每一类包含的数据点的均值，将该类的聚类中心点移动至均值所在的位置。这便是一次迭代过程

  4. 重复2~3，直至K个聚类中心都停止移动，完成迭代

(2) 数学定义

Randomly initialize K cluster centroids μ1,μ2...,μk∈RRepeat{for i=1 to mc(i):index(from 1 to K)of clustercentroids closet to x(i)for k=1 toKμk:=average(mean)of point assigned to cluster k}

其中,μ1,μ2...μk表示K个聚类中心位置。

c(i)表示第i个样本到K个聚类中心得最小距离，即：

c(i)=mink||x(i)−μk||2

(3) Cost Function ( Distortion function 畸变函数)

J(c(1)...,c(m),μ1,...,μk)=1m∑i=1m||X(i)−μ(c(i))||2
